thread.title: Neil Patrick Harris Gets His First Tattoo in Honor of 'A Series of Unfortunate Events' Season 2 Renewal
thread.title_full: Neil Patrick Harris Gets His First Tattoo in Honor of 'A Series of Unfortunate Events' Season 2 Renewal

author: Rachel McRady
title: Neil Patrick Harris Gets His First Tattoo in Honor of 'A Series of Unfortunate Events' Season 2 Renewal
text: Neil Patrick Harris Gets His First Tattoo in Honor of ‘A Series of Unfortunate Events’ Season 2 Renewal by Rachel McRady 6:15 AM PDT, March 14, 2017 Photo: Getty Images Celebratory ink! Neil Patrick Harris took the plunge and got his first tattoo on Monday for a very special reason. WATCH: Neil Patrick Harris' Twins Fit Right in With the New York Art Scene -- See the Cute Pic! The Netflix star took to Instagram to show off his tat in honor of his show Lemony Snicket’s A Series of Unfortunate Events getting renewed for a second season. A post shared by Neil Patrick Harris (@nph) on Mar 13, 2017 at 1:42pm PDT “We got picked up for Season 2 of A Series of Unfortunate Events. I got this to celebrate. #firsttattoo #anklebone #oof#olaf #scampstamp @andersonluna@unfortunatetv @netflix,” he captioned the pic. The body art is located on Harris’ ankle and features the mystical eye that is the symbol of his evil character Count Olaf. It’s quite a process for Harris to transform into the villainous Count Olaf. He dished about the experience to ET in January. WATCH: EXCLUSIVE: Neil Patrick Harris Dishes on Intricate 'Lemony Snicket' Costuming and Playful Parenting Techniques "It takes about three hours to get all the stuff on, and then all day long you have to make sure it's not coming off," Harris explained . "So all day long someone's just poking at your face. All day--literally, nine hours of someone between takes just [fixing your makeup.]" For more from the show, watch the clip below!
